usefulItems: springform tin (Ø 25 cm), wire rack, large bowl, skewer, cling film, aluminium foil, oven
title: Pogača (bread)

ingredients.content: 60 g unsalted butter, plus extra for greasing

preparations.content: Place milk in mixing bowl and heat <b>3 min/95°C/speed 4<b>.
Add butter then stir <b>10 sec/speed 3<b>.  Set mixing bowl aside to cool to 50°C.
Add yeast and sugar then stir <b>1 min/speed 3<b>. Scrape down sides of mixing bowl with spatula.

Add flour, sour cream, oil, egg and salt, mix <b>20 sec/speed 3<b> then knead <b>5 min/<b>. Transfer to a large greased bowl. Turn over dough to oil both sides then cover and leave to rise until doubled in size (approx. 1-2 hours). Towards the end of this time, preheat oven to 180°C.

Knock back risen dough and place in a springform tin (Ø 25 cm, 7.5 cm deep) or form a 25 cm round and place on a lined baking sheet. Using a sharp knife, slash top of dough 3 times. Bake for 50-60 minutes (180°C) until a skewer inserted in the centre comes out clean, covering with foil if getting too brown.
Transfer to a wire rack to cool for 10 minutes then remove from tin to cool completely.

hintsAndTricks: Pogacha, (pogača in Balkan spelling), is a white bread that Serbians, Croatians, Macedonians and other Balkans, Turks and Hungarians all claim as their own. It is similar to Italian Vienna bread in texture and flavour and there are as many recipes for it as there are shapes, although round is the most traditional.
